main event: On 18 December 1957 in La Creste, Gibraltar, a ground-radar observation reported a single unidentified object with a long greenish yellow tail, seen in straight and level flight for 1 minute.
interesting points: Observation lasted for 10 minutes, indicating a prolonged sighting.
The object appeared, stopped, and then appeared again, displaying unusual flight behavior.
No photographs were taken during the observation, limiting the visual evidence.
The report suggests the possibility of an astronomical meteor, but no conclusive explanation was provided.
The document contains communications indicating attempts to make contact with interceptor aircraft, adding to the intrigue of the incident.
sighted object: a single unidentified object with a long greenish yellow tail
witnesses: GGyr Air Visual ground radar observation
